Recorded in Kampala, Uganda in February 2025, ‚ÄòThird Time Lucky‚Äô is a call for Africa‚Äôs third liberation sung by Bobi Wine, mixed by Paddyman, and written by Robin Auld and Greg Mills.

The song was released to raise awareness of the rendition and trial by military tribunal of the Ugandan opposition icon, Dr Kizza Besigye. It includes appeals to ‚ÄòFree Kizza‚Äô from democrats across the world, including Nobel laureate Oleksandra Matviichuk, former presidents Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Andr√©s Pastrana, Martin Torrijos and Ian Khama, former Prime Minister Moeketsi Majoro, the Archbishop of Cape Town Thabo Makgoba, and ministers and opposition leaders from across Africa, Latin America, and Europe.

english_translation:
Campaign for the liberation of Dr Kizza Besigye, political prisoner in Uganda.

Recorded in Kampala, Uganda in February 2025, ‚ÄòThird Time Lucky‚Äô is a call for Africa‚Äôs third liberation sung by Bobi Wine, mixed by Paddyman, and written by Robin Auld and Greg Mills.

The song was released to raise awareness of the rendition and trial by military tribunal of the Ugandan opposition icon, Dr Kizza Besigye. It includes appeals to ‚ÄòFree Kizza‚Äô from democrats across the world, including Nobel laureate Oleksandra Matviichuk, former presidents Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Andr√©s Pastrana, Martin Torrijos and Ian Khama, former Prime Minister Moeketsi Majoro, the Archbishop of Cape Town Thabo Makgoba, and ministers and opposition leaders from across Africa, Latin America, and Europe.

english_translation: Yesterday we began our work journey in the east of the country, passing through X√°-Muteba and Cafunfo, in Lunda-Norte province. (Liga da Mulher Angolana), Cesaltina Kulanda, sa√∫da a Povoa√ß√£o de Kayeye. Mesmo em tempos marcados por crises profundas e uma gest√£o que falha com o nosso povo, a resili√™ncia e a alegria dos angolanos inspiramnos a lutar por um futuro de justi√ßa e renova√ß√£o.

english_translation: LUNDA-NORTE|| Yesterday, Sunday, March 2, we bid farewell to the people of Cafunfo and headed towards the city of Dundo, where, even arriving at 11 PM, we were welcomed by a crowd determined to hear our message of hope. english_translation: Yesterday was dedicated to dialogue with different strata of society in the city of Dundo. Women of Angola, this Women's March we affirm that: - Delaying reforms is acting against women; - Refusing local governments is reducing opportunities for women; it is acting against women; - Denying the Independence of the Judiciary is an attack on women; - Approving laws that enhance the repressive state is an attack on women, because it creates limitations on freedoms, generates mourning, generates suffering, disaggregates homes and women are always the most sacrificed and on whom the consequences fall, without being heard or consulted.

tweet_text: Safely back in Addis after being kicked out of Angola. I thank the Kenyan Mission in Luanda led by Amb. Joyce Mmaitsi. You guys are great. english_translation: Safely back in Addis after being kicked out of Angola. I thank the Kenyan Mission in Luanda led by Amb. Joyce Mmaitsi. You guys are great. tweet_text:
AUTOCRACY EXPOSED IN ANGOLA  

I arrived in Angola as part of the Platform for African Democrats, alongside the World Liberty Congress delegation, to participate in a crucial summit on the Future of Democracy in Africa. Jo√£o Louren√ßo‚Äôs regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to stop our gathering.

  I personally witnessed 12 delegates being deported before even entering the country.
  Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without explanation.
  The regime deliberately obstructed our transportation, to prevent us from reaching Benguela.

These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has proven that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights.

But let this be clear: We will not be intimidated. The fight for democracy in Angola is the fight for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our struggle for freedom.

 #Democracy   #Angola   #WorldLibertyCongress   #AfricaDemocrats   https:// t.co/5o0sLitY38

Jo√£o Louren√ßo‚Äôs regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to stop our gathering. I personally witnessed 12 delegates being deported before even entering the country. Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without explanation. The regime deliberately obstructed our transportation, to prevent us from reaching Benguela. These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has proven that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights. But let this be clear: We will not be intimidated. The fight for democracy in Angola is the fight for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our struggle for freedom. #Democracy #Angola #WorldLibertyCongress #AfricaDemocrats https://t.co/5o0sLitY38

tweet_text:
AUTORITARISMO EN ANGOLA  

Llegu√© a Angola como parte de la Plataforma de Dem√≥cratas Africanos, junto con la delegaci√≥n del World Liberty Congress, para participar en una cumbre clave sobre el Futuro de la Democracia en √Åfrica. El r√©gimen de Jo√£o Louren√ßo respondi√≥ con represi√≥n, hostigamiento y sabotaje para impedir nuestro encuentro.

  Fui testigo directo de la deportaci√≥n de 12 delegados antes de que pudieran entrar al pa√≠s.
  Expresidentes y dignatarios fueron detenidos hasta 9 horas sin ninguna explicaci√≥n.
  El r√©gimen sabote√≥ nuestra movilidad para impedirnos llegar a Benguela.

Estas son las t√°cticas de las dictaduras que temen la democracia. El r√©gimen de Angola ha demostrado que no respeta las libertades y los derechos fundamentales.

No nos intimidar√°n. La lucha por la democracia en Angola es la lucha por la democracia en todas partes. Ninguna represi√≥n detendr√° nuestra lucha por la libertad de todas las autocracias. 

 #Democracia   #Angola   #WorldLibertyCongress   #AfricaDemocrats
english_translation: AUTHORITARIANISM IN ANGOLA I arrived in Angola as part of the Platform of African Democrats, along with the World Liberty Congress delegation, to participate in a key summit on the Future of Democracy in Africa. Jo√£o Louren√ßo's regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to prevent our meeting. I directly witnessed the deportation of 12 delegates before they could enter the country. Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without any explanation. The regime sabotaged our mobility to prevent us from reaching Benguela. These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has shown that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights. We will not be intimidated. The struggle for democracy in Angola is the struggle for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our fight for freedom from all autocracies. #Democracy #Angola #WorldLibertyCongress #AfricaDemocrats
